title.narrative: Better Governance for Adaptation to Climate Change

description.narrative: Overall objective of the project is the community-based coastal resources with adaptation to climate change in Cat Hai island district Hai Phong City is sustainably managed contributing to poverty reduction and socio-economic development for the local peop le.Specific objectives of the project are as follows:- To raise awareness of local government and community on issues of environment climate change and sustainable development.- To improve local governance by promoting co-management of natural resources an d mobilizing participation of local in making decisions related to their life. - To protect environment and build local capacity to adapt to climate change (preparedness against natural disaster) for sustainable livelihoods and development of Cat Hai dist rict in generalThe 4 expected results of the project include: Expected Result 1: By December 2014 the awareness of 100% of aquaculture households 80% of the government officers of DPC and 50% of the bays? coastal households are raised on climate change and environment for sustainable development, 100% of aquaculture households adjust their behaviors to more friendly to sea water environment.Expected Result 2: By December 2014 the ?co-management? mechanism between local people and Cat Ba Bay Management is es tablished and enhanced. The local regulation of water management and action plan will be prepared and implemented with participation of local people.Expected Result 3: By December 2014 the sanitation of the sea water in Cat Ba Bay and Lan Ha Bay is improve d according to environment standards in comparison with the situation in October 2012. The water environment is fine enough for keeping aquaculture sustainableExpected Result 4: By December 2014 sustainable livelihoods for households of aquaculture and es pecially for poor households or households having sea dependent livelihoods are strengthened. The new model of feeding fish with industrial foods will be successfully piloted and studied by 80% of the aquaculture households. The income will be improved for more than 50% of the aquaculture households.?100% aquaculture households will well prepared for potential typhoon.?
